content:
• Friday, October 4, 2013
  • DRYS

    DryShips announces $200M stock offering, shares -7.4% AH

    • DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS), which had a market cap of just $1.53B as of today's close, is offering the shares via Evercore. (PR)
    • CEO George Economou: "Drybulk shipping rates and ship values have increased recently and we believe this trend will continue particularly in the larger asset classes ... we believe this is an opportune time to flexibly access the equity capital markets to reduce some or all of our funding needs through 2014 that we currently estimate at [$150M]."
    • He adds DryShips is "nearing agreements" with banks to lower debt service payments over the next year and adjust covenant terms, and that the company's Ocean Rig fleet operated at a record 98.5% efficiency in Q3 on available for drilling days.
    • DryShips had $4.44B in debt at the end of Q2, and $511.4M in cash/equivalents.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:06 PM | 9 Comments
  • TWGP

    Tower Group exploring P-E investment, WSJ reports

    • Tower Group (NASDAQ:TWGP) is seeking ways to bolster its capital as the insurer substantially increases its commercial claims reserves following a big hit from superstorm Sandy, and it has recently approached P-E firms, including Blackstone (NYSE:BX), KKR and Warburg Pincus, in an effort to raise money, WSJ reports.
    • TWGP said in August it could face a charge of $60M-$110M against earnings to boost its reserves, and the money raised would shore up its capital base once the charge is taken; the insurer also could seek to raise some or all of the new money in the public markets.
    • Shares -2.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:49 PM | 4 Comments

  • After-Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top Gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: FST +10.6%. OUTR +8.6%. CLDT +6.3%. KBH +6.2%. CTB +5.9%.
    • Top Losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: CAMP -8.1%. TISI -6.2%. RVBD -5.7%. NGVC -5.1%. RKUS -4.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • ACHN

    RA Capital Management reports ~15% passive stake in Achillion

    • Beleaguered Achillion Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACHN) rises 2.2% AH.
    • RA Capital Management has reported a 14.9% passive stake. (13G)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM | 1 Comment

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: TAN +7.86%. VXX +6.13%. EPI +5.15%. FCG +3.13%. VNM +2.82%.
    • Losers: GDXJ -7.16%. GDX -3.85%. UNG -2.27%. GAZ -2.16%. EWJ -2.16%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • OUTR

    More on Outerwall/Jana

    • Jana, run by fund manager Barry Rosenstein, owns 3.78M Outerwall (NASDAQ:OUTR) shares, good for a 13.5% stake.
    • The firm states in a 13D it " intends to have discussions" with Outerwall's board and management about "strategic alternatives" that include selling part or all of the company, altering its capital structure, changing its capital allocation policy, and cutting costs.
    • Outerwall plunged last month in response to a Q3/2013 warning blamed on weaker-than-expected Redbox performance. The company simultaneously added $100M to its buyback plan, stated it would "align its cost structure," and promised to speed up a review of its New Ventures initiatives (inc. the ecoATM electronics recycling kiosk business).
    • Outerwall doesn't yet pay a dividend.
    • Shares +6% AH after finishing regular trading up 9.4%.
    • Previous: Jana Partners discloses Outerwall stake
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 3 Comments
  • OUTR

    Jana Partners discloses Outerwall stake, shares soar

    • Outerwall (OUTR +9.6%) took off just before the close on news of the disclosure.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • CPST

    Capstone Turbine shares seen surging nearly 70% by Cowen

    • Capstone Turbine (CPST +7.1%) is initiated with an Outperform rating at Cowen, whose $1.90 price target would represent a near-70% upside from yesterday's close.
    • The firm projects a five-year revenue CAGR of 23%, from $128M in 2013 to $365M in 2018, and gross margin should expand to ~35% from 11.3% on higher utilization, cost reduction and lower warranty and royalty expense; operating margin should turn positive in 2015 and reach 16% by 2017.
    • Thanks to a low tax rate and minimal capex, the firm says free cash flow should grow substantially from 2015, and its model yields high return on invested capital once once scale is achieved.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 2 Comments
  • DWDP

    Dow Chemical to challenge Monsanto with insect-killing soybeans

    • Dow Chemical (DOW +2.8%) reveals plans to challenge Monsanto’s (MON +0.2%) insect-repelling soybeans for South America with beans engineered to kill pests with two added genes.
    • MON estimates the market for its Intacta beans, which are being introduced on 3M acres this year and have one Bt gene to control bugs, at 100M acres; Dow says having two Bt genes with different modes of action will slow insects’ ability to overcome the technology.
    • Dow says the new soybeans should be available in Brazil and Argentina in three to five years, pending regulatory approvals.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • OPEN

    Piper's OpenTable upgrade: Firm likes new marketing efforts

    • Piper's Michael Olson, who upgraded OpenTable (OPEN +1.2%) to Overweight this morning, thinks the restaurant reservation platform's growth strategy is "shifting toward a renewed focus on consumer marketing and mobile growth," and is a fan of the move.
    • Olson sees OpenTable's efforts, which include the hiring of new marketing personnel and are expected to feature a pickup in mobile ad spend, leading to "an acceleration in OpenTable adoption during 2014-15." That, in turn, is expected to yield "an inflection point similar to what occurred for online travel during the early 2000s."
    • His PT is now at $80, or a full 35x a 2014 EPS estimate of $2.28 (consensus is at $2.21).
    • Shares now +44% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • PII

    Polaris rallies on UBS outlook for Indian brand

    • Polaris Industries (PII +3.3%) rallies as UBS raises its price target on the shares to $142 from $121.
    • "Channel checks indicate strong response to the Indian brand," Analyst Robin Farley says, adding that "it sounds [like] from both mgmt & channel checks that the biggest issue for Indian is supply constraints."
    • In light of this, UBS is sticking with its current year outlook but sees upside to estimates in 2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM | 3 Comments
  • ANGI

    Angie's List keeps sliding, sell-side defends company

    • Angie's List (ANGI -2.7%) investors continue to worry about the long-term implications of a membership price-cut test that has apparently ended. Groupon's plans to encroach on the local services site's turf (with the help of a former Angie's exec) might also be taking a toll.
    • The declines come even though multiple analysts have defended Angie's. Needham's Kerry Rice thinks the impact of the price cuts could be offset by higher sign-up and renewal rates, and also believes they might lower Angie's sales/marketing spend.
    • Northland's Darren Aftahi predicts over 90% of Angie's revenue will come from service providers over the long haul (the figure was at 73% in Q2), and that a membership price cut "could accelerate SP revenue growth" by creating a larger advertising audience.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM | 3 Comments
  • AABA

    Alibaba IPO reportedly proceeding slowly; Yahoo makes new highs

    • "These guys haven’t even hired bankers yet," says a source talking to Marketwatch's John Shinal about Alibaba's anticipated IPO. The source and another person "familiar" with Alibaba's plans state the Chinese e-commerce giant won't go public until next year. As is is, the company woudl've been under a very tight schedule if it wanted to do a 2013 IPO.
    • Yahoo (YHOO +3.3%) is nonetheless making new multi-year highs again today, as Alibaba IPO fervor continues to grow (perhaps aided a little by Twitter IPO fervor). Yahoo's Q3 report arrives on Oct. 15; it should be accompanied by Alibaba's Q2 results.
    • Previous: Bankers reportedly want Alibaba to have $100B IPO valuation
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM | 2 Comments
  • STJ

    St. Jude Medical jumps on analysts' reading of FDA Champion System documents

    • St. Jude Medical (STJ +3.4%) rises to an all-time high on heavy volume.
    • Briefing documents from the FDA regarding an advisory panel meeting for CardioMEMS' Champion Heart Failure Monitoring System seem to suggest the regulator is more likely to approve the device this time around — or at least that's RBC and Leerink's reading. (full briefing documents)
    • "We think there's a few clauses in the conclusion where the FDA reviewers portray subtle inclinations," RBC's Glenn Novarro says.
    • Meanwhile, Leerink's Danielle Antalffy is already looking forward to an STJ deal for CardioMEMS: "We estimate [Champion HF] can ultimately contribute an incremental $0.25-$0.50 in EPS." (IBD)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • FB

    Facebook rallies following Instagram/Twitter news, another PT hike

    • Facebook (FB +3.6%) has rallied back above $50 following a Thursday afternoon that saw Instagram announce brand ads are coming and Twitter file its public S-1. Bullish notes from Sterne Agee and William Blair could be helping out.
    • Sterne's Arvind Bhatia, who has been bullish on Facebook since its pre-IPO days, has raised his PT to $58 from $50 to account for Instagram's ad launch and "better-than-expected ongoing trends." His target equals a lofty 20x multiple on 2015E adjusted EBITDA of $6.8B (raised from a prior $6.3B).
    • Blair's Ralph Schackart joins analysts at Goldman and Raymond James in reporting Facebook advertiser talks were encouraging.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM | 3 Comments
  • WDC

    SanDisk, Micron, mobile chipmakers rally following Samsung forecast

    • SanDisk (SNDK +2.6%) and Micron (MU +1.6%) are adding to their 2013 gains after rival memory giant Samsung provided a Q3 op. profit guidance range whose midpoint is above analyst estimates.
    • Samsung, whose full results arrive later this month, has been expected to report strong numbers for its DRAM/NAND flash ops, thanks to strong mobile demand and a favorable supply/demand balance that got better following a massive fire at a Chinese SK Hynix DRAM fab.
    • Several other chipmakers with strong mobile exposure, some of whom are major suppliers to Samsung's mobile device unit, are also rallying: SYNA +4.4%. OVTI +3.6%. SWKS +3.2%. RFMD +2.7%. ANAD +2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • PVAC

    Penn Virgina surges as Howard Weil sees decade-long growth

    • Penn Virginia (PVA +8.8%) shares surge after the energy explorer had its target price raised to $12 from $10 by Howard Weil, citing "tremendous upside" with PVA's current assets despite a recent rise in the stock.
    • The compelling acreage position in the Eagle Ford, where PVA has ~66K net acres, should fuel growth over the next decade, the firm says; PVA has delineated the acreage block and has 10 years of engineered locations with the potential to almost double that.
    • The firm says underlying valuation remains one of the most compelling for onshore operators at just 55% of NAV and just 3.7x 2014 EBITDA.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • PRXL

    PAREXEL jumps as ISI gets bullish

    • PAREXEL (PRXL +4.1%) enjoys a strong session.
    • Earlier, ISI's Ross Muken upgraded the stock to Buy from Neutral.
    • Muken has a positive outlook for the clinical research organization space based on "improved pipeline success rates at biopharma, a rebound in biotech funding, and continued vendor consolidation among sponsors."
    • Price target raised to $57 from $52.50.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: DSCO +40%. IDRA +17%. MOBI +15%. PDEX +14%. ADHD +14%. OTC:PGRX +13%. QUIK +13%. GALT +12%. PLG +12%. FONR +13%.
    • Top 10 Losers: BLDP -15%. CVM -15%. LCI -13%. OTC:AMCF -13%. ZLCS -10%. EDAP -8%. NBS -9%. FU -8%. CPSL -8%. GAGA -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • PBPB

    The numbers don't lie: Food and restaurant IPOs rocking this year

    • Restaurant chains in the U.S. have struggled to keep same-store sales growth over the 25 level and food companies have seen margins pinched, but new faces in the sector have done amazingly well.
    • Potbelly (NASDAQ:PBPB) is up 135% over its IPO opening price today.
    • Noodles (NASDAQ:NDLS) maintained an even keel since its first couple of weeks of trading, up 139% post-IPO.
    • Fairway (NASDAQ:FWM) is the laggard of the bunch, trading at a 95% premium to the food seller's IPO price.
    • Earlier: Which restaurant chain will test the IPO waters next?
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • XOM

    Exxon secures extra $1.5B financing for PNG LNG project

    • Exxon Mobil (XOM +0.7%) has secured an additional $1.5B in debt financing for its $19B Papua New Guinea liquefied natural gas project, according to project partner Oil Search (OIS +1.7%).
    • The $1.5B in supplemental financing will help cover overruns at the 6.9M metric tons/year LNG development, where costs have climbed to $19B.
    • The PNG LNG project is the country's biggest-ever resources development and could lift GDP by 20%; OIS says the project remains on track to deliver its first LNG cargoes in 2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM | 4 Comments
  • SRPT

    Sarepta rallies as Piper upbeat on eteplirsen NDA

    • Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT +4.9%) is on the move, and with today's gains the shares are up some 10% since Wednesday when disappointing dystrophin production data from Prosensa's (NASDAQ:RNA) drisapersen boosted sentiment around eteplirsen.
    • Today's catalyst appears to be a note out of Piper which emphasizes eteplirsen's safety profile.
    • SRPT is now up more than 50% since the end of August.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • SINA

    Chinese Internet stocks rally after Twitter S-1 filed

    • Chinese Internet firms, already shown plenty of love by momentum traders this year, are rallying again following the release of Twitter's public S-1.
    • Chinese microblogging leader Sina (SINA +4%) is among the gainers, and so are fellow social networking plays YY (YY +3.2%) and Renren (RENN +9.7%). But several other names are also taking part in the rally: BIDU +2%. NQ +2.7%. CYOU +6.9%. DANG +4.1%. SOHU +5.4%. SFUN +5.8%. AMAP +3.4%. QIHU +2%.
    • Twitter mentioned in its S-1 78% of the 218.3M monthly active users it had at the end of Q2 were outside the U.S. But few of them are in China, where its services (like Facebook's) are generally blocked.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 2 Comments
  • HCP

    HCP continues to slide after CEO ouster

    • Though HCP (HCP -1.9%) management reiterated its commitment to current strategy, it's natural to assume some changes, says Cowen's James Sullivan. Also, new CEO Lauralee Martin's advanced age could raise questions about the length of her tenure.
    • Then there's Martin's experience (with Jones Lang Lasalle) and conference call comments - both of which suggest an increased emphasis on international opportunities, possibly raising concerns with existing shareholders.
    • RBC's Michael Carroll downgrades the stock to sell and cuts his price target to $38 from $49, arguing booted CEO Jay Flaherty warranted a premium valuation for the shares.
    • Previous: Boardroom shake-up at HCP, and Citi awaits another shoe to drop.
    • Also: Seeking Alpha's The Value Investor says it's a buying opportunity.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • CPHD

    Cepheid falls on ISI downgrade

    • Cepheid (CPHD -2.7%) slips as ISI's Vijay Kumar downgrades the shares to Sell from Cautious.
    • Kumar cites increased competition, slowing base business, limited upside, pricing pressure, and "structurally higher cost of goods sold."
    • ISI sees revenue below consensus, which it says should "continue to drift lower over the next few quarters."
    • Q3 earnings are due on the 17th.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • NOW

    Northland's ServiceNow upgrade: Customers talks "very positive"

    • Northland's Tim Klasell, who upgraded ServiceNow (NOW +5.1%) to Outperform today, says talks with new and "soon to be new" customers and integrators were "very positive," and surprisingly turned up strong interest in adopting ServiceNow's entire cloud-based IT operations/service desk platform (rather than just core apps).
    • Klasell sees this interest not only yielding a larger market opportunity, but also potentially leading investors to assign higher multiples to ServiceNow, since "platform revenues are sticker while offering a more open-ended opportunity."
    • Shares are making new post-IPO highs, and are now up 82% YTD.
    • Morgan Stanley and Canaccord launched coverage with bullish ratings last month.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • PBR

    Petrobras reacts to Moody's downgrade, says investments will boost output

    • Petrobras (PBR -1.6%) responds to a Moody's credit rating downgrade by saying the company's five-year $237B investment program will lead to increased output and cash flow.
    • PBR says it has adopted a more rigorous procedure for approval of new projects, and the implementation of its investment plan will significantly raise its output of oil and natural gas; PBR forecasts production of 3.4M boe/day by 2017 and 5.2M by 2020.
    • PBR's current debt profile is "well distributed and balanced in relation to future cash flow," the company says, adding that debt maturities, which average seven years or more, are timed to coincide with increased production and cash generation.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 4 Comments
  • FST

    In big reversal, Forest Oil -5.5% after favorable initial reaction to asset sale

    • Gain turns to pain for Forest Oil (FST -5.5%), whose big premarket rise is now a sharp decline as analysts say FST failed to receive a premium for its $1B sale of Texas Panhandle assets.
    • Stifel Nicolaus says the deal was largely in line with prior transactions at 5.5x EV/T12M EBITDA vs. the corporate average of 5.2x EV/2014 EBITDA or $60K per flowing barrel.
    • Jefferies says it’s not clear where growth will come from after the sale, and FST will need to eventually pursue acquisitions to bolster its portfolio.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM | 1 Comment
  • HIMX

    Himax up following positive Cramer mention

    • Jim Cramer, who previously recommended Himax (HIMX +2.7%) in August, mentioned during last night's episode of Mad Money he's still bullish on the LCD display driver/LCOS microdisplay vendor, and thinks shares are worth $13-$14.
    • Himax shares are now up 361% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 11 Comments
  • PDEX

    Seeking Alpha moves stocks

    • Pro-Dex (PDEX +15.5%) flies as SA Pro's Whopper Investments digs up another "net-net." The stock has struggled amid management missteps and the loss of a major customer, but activist investors have succeeded in ousting management and the board. Since these outsiders became insiders, they've been buying even more.
    • The article is embargoed until tomorrow morning.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • AAXN

    Taser rally sputters as stock falls for second day

    • Taser (TASR -6.6%) is in the midst of a mini-tailspin, with the shares now off some 16% in two days.
    • The stock took a hit Thursday after the company announced price cuts on the AXON flex and EVIDENCE.com service.
    • Not helping the cause is Sidoti, where analysts downgraded the stock from Buy to Neutral earlier this week.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • APFC

    Reuters: American Pacific may sell itself

    • Chemical maker American Pacific (APFC +10.2%) is considering selling itself, Reuters reports.
    • Sources say APFC is in advanced talks with bidders on a sale and could announce a transaction in the near future; the company is said to have hired KeyBanc to advise on the sale.
    • Shares have risen nearly fivefold in the past year.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • CRZO

    Carrizo Oil & Gas started with a Buy rating at Sterne Agee

    • Carrizo Oil & Gas (CRZO +1.6%) is initiated with a Buy rating and $50 price target at Sterne Agee, even after the stock's 96% YTD rally.
    • The firm says Eagle Ford downspacing testing and drilling results from the Utica Shale should validate the quality and depth of CRZO's inventory in these plays, and potential bolt-on acquisitions with proceeds from a non-core asset sale should provide further running room to complement core positions in the Eagle Ford Shale and Niobrara.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • EWI

    Berlusconi likely to be expelled from Parliament

    • An Italian Senate panel recommends Silvio Berlusconi be expelled from that body.
    • The criminally-convicted former PM roiled Italian markets in September by threatening to pull his party out of the governing coalition, but read the tea leaves and backed down earlier this week.
    • In a tough week for equities, EWI is ahead nearly 3% after today's 1.4% gain.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • BDBD

    Lake Street sees upside for Boulder Brands

    • Lake Street starts Boulder Brands (BDBD +1.1%) at Buy.
    • Price target is $19, representing a 21% premium to Thursday's close.
    • See also: Greenberg says red flags flying over Boulder Brands.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • FTNT

    Fortinet rallies after Oppenheimer forecasts strong Q3 results

    • Oppenheimer, which has been bullish on Fortinet (FTNT +4.8%) for nearly a year, says checks point to strong deal activity, and thinks the UTM security hardware leader's Q3 numbers will come in at the high end of its guidance ranges.
    • Fortinet has missed out on this year's tech rally. Shares were hammered earlier this year following a Q1 warning, and the company has been contending with a CFO transition.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • KKD

    The Krispy Kreme Doughnuts rally is on

    • Shares of Krispy Kreme Doughnuts (KKD +4.3%) are now up a double-digit percentage over the last two days without any concrete news of note.
    • Unless there is some strong correlation between government workers being idled and doughnut consumption, the best bet is that Krispy Kreme may be working its way back into a status as a momentum favorite with traders.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM | 4 Comments
  • PCYC

    Pharmacyclics' ibrutinib to become "backbone standard of care": Wells Fargo

    • Wells Fargo jumps on the Pharmacyclics (PCYC +4.7%) bandwagon, initiating coverage at Outperform with a $155-160 price target.
    • Analyst Matthew Andrews joins JPMorgan's Cory Kasimov, Deutsche's
      Robyn K, William Blair, and Lazard in expressing a profoundly optimistic view on ibrutinib.
    • "We believe ibrutinib has the potential to be Revlimid-, Rituxan-, or Gleevec-like in its global revenue trajectory and impact in treating various blood cancers, and see it becoming a backbone standard of care," Andrews says, adding that the stock is undervalued despite running up ~130% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • PBPB

    Potbelly skyrockets in opening trades

    • Potbelly (NASDAQ:PBPB) opens trading at $28.66 a share, double the company's pricing of $14 a pop.
    • The sandwich shop has 286 outlets in the U.S. with a strong brand loyalty which typically bodes well for IPO demand.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM | 6 Comments
  • LCI

    Lannett prices offering, shares tumble

    • Lannett (LCI -13.3%) slides after pricing a ~5.9M share offering at $18, a 16% discount to Thursday's close.
    • LCI is offering 4.25M of the shares, with the balance being sold by selling stockholders, one of which has granted the underwriters an option on 880K additional shares. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • AMGN

    Amgen to present multiple abstracts on bone drugs

    • Amgen (AMGN +1.2%) is set to present new data on romosozumab and Prolia at ASBMR.
    • The company says the Prolia data demonstrate the long-term safety and efficacy of the osteoporosis drug. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • MNST

    It's Nielsen data day for beverage stocks

    • Nielsen data is out and is reportedly positive for Monster Beverage (MNST +1.1%) and Molson Coors (TAP +0.4%).
    • Both stocks have perked up as word spreads.
    • Details on the Nielsen data to follow.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • NOW

    A roundup of tech ratings changes

    • ServiceNow (NOW +2.5%) has been upgraded to Outperform by Northland.
    • OpenTable (OPEN +1.6%) has been upgraded to Overweight by Piper.
    • Portugal Telecom (PT-OLD) has been upgraded to Buy by Berenberg a day after getting cut to Neutral by Citi, and two days after announcing plans to merge with Oibr.
    • iGate (IGTE -3.1%) has been cut to Neutral by Nomura.
    • Acxiom (ACXM -1.1%) has been cut to Underperform by BMO.
    • Align Technology (ALGN -3.4%) has been cut to Neutral by Baird.
    • NXP (NXPI +0.7%) has been started at Outperform by Pac Crest.
    • Sensata (ST +0.9%) has been started at Outperform by Wells Fargo.
    • RingCentral (RNG +0.2%), which went public just a week ago, has been started at Outperform by Northland.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • IMAX

    IMAX in focus

    • IMAX (IMAX +0.2%) continues to be one of the media stocks drawing the most attention over Q3 movie box office sales trends.
    • The name is quickly becoming a battleground stock. Bears have the won the week with shares down close to 10%, but bulls see Q4 titles such as Gravity, The Hobbit: The Desolation Of Smaug, and The Hunger Games: Catching Fire burning up sales for the IMAX format.
    • What to watch: Strong demand for IMAX films in China is critical for the company's success. Early returns are good as IMAX is a premium brand in the nation.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM | 1 Comment
  • AAN

    Aaron's lowers guidance, shares swoon

    • Shares of Aaron's (NYSE:AAN) tumble after the company lowers its guidance on profits.
    • The company projects Q3 EPS will fall in a range of $0.37 to $0.41 after initially pegging it at $0.48-$0.52.
    • AAN -6.4% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • IDRA

    Idera Pharmaceuticals moves sharply higher as HealthCor discloses stake

    • Idera Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IDRA) jumps 14% premarket on top of 24% Thursday.
    • Likely behind the move is HealthCor Management, who reported a 5.6% stake. (13G)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: DSCO +54%. IDRA +14%. OTC:ASTI +9%. CPST +5%. NBG +5%.
    • Losers: BLDP -14%. LCI -11%. NBS -11%. AAN -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • WINT

    Discovery Laboratories skyrockets as FDA approves Surfaxin specs

    • Discovery Laboratories (DSCO) soars 60% premarket as the FDA agrees to the updated specs for Surfaxin.
    • Back in April, the regulator requested clarification after the company modified Surfaxin's specifications upon discovering that one of the methods used to assess product conformance needed "improvement."
    • The drug, which prevents respiratory distress syndrome in premature infants, is now set for commercial introduction in Q4. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM
  • BLDP

    Ballard Power down big premarket on 9M-unit offering

    • Ballard Power (NASDAQ:BLDP) -8.6% premarket after announcing a public offering of 9M units at $1.40/unit, a 13.5% discount to yesterday's closing price.
    • Each unit in the offering is comprised of one common share and 0.25 of a warrant to purchase one common share.
    • BLDP says proceeds will be used to fund working capital requirements, support continued growth and for other general corporate purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:25 AM
  • FST

    Forest Oil surges on Texas asset sale

    • Forest Oil (NYSE:FST) +12.1% premarket after yesterday's post-close announcement of a $1B sale of its Texas Panhandle oil and gas assets to a company backed by PE firm First Reserve.
    • The sales price is greater than FST's ~$770M market cap.
    • FST says the sale enables it to focus development of its core Eagle Ford Shale assets; it doesn't expect to incur any income taxes on the sale and intends to use the proceeds primarily to reduce debt and bolster financial flexibility.
    • The properties sold have produced ~100M cf/day YTD and have estimated proved reserves of 517B cf of gas; FST had said earlier that it was seeking a buyer for the assets after receiving unsolicited offers.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:11 AM
